titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Western Americana Collection of Miscellaneous Financial Materials Concerning Oil Companies Operating in the North American West
Western Americana Collection of Miscellaneous Financial Materials Concerning Oil Companies Operating in the North American West
titlestmt.author: by Ellen Ellickson and Caroline Wilcox Reul

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday November 30, 2018 at 05:08

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous financial materials concerning oil companies operating in the North American West

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: This collection, compiled by William H. Brown, contains a variety of financial documents concerning oil companies operating in the North American West. Examples of these documents include informational pamphlets, company magazines, fact sheets, maps, memorandums, newspaper clippings, press releases, company correspondence, reports and analyses, letters to the stockholders, stockholder resolutions, petitions for secondary stock offerings, bond offerings, subscription forms, proxy statements, prospectuses, election forms, mortgage and trust indentures, deposit and trust agreements, reorganization plans and agreements, consolidation plans, and court documents. While all of these documents are represented in the collection, they are not all represented by each company.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Most of these financial materials were part of a collection acquired by Yale in 1922 from William H. Brown of West Haven, Conn. The collection, initially called the William H. Brown Statistical Library, numbered some 23,000 documents and covered the years 1890 to 1917. The collection was merged with similar materials already in the University Library and later expanded by gifts from Brown and others to become what is now known as the William H. Brown Collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection, compiled by William H. Brown, contains a variety of financial documents concerning oil companies operating in the North American West. Examples of these documents include informational pamphlets, company magazines, fact sheets, maps, memorandums, newspaper clippings, press releases, company correspondence, reports and analyses, letters to the stockholders, stockholder resolutions, petitions for secondary stock offerings, bond offerings, subscription forms, proxy statements, prospectuses, election forms, mortgage and trust indentures, deposit and trust agreements, reorganization plans and agreements, consolidation plans, and court documents. While all of these documents are represented in the collection, they are not all represented by each company.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Trade organizations, government agencies and other industry-related entities are listed first, after which oil companies are arranged in call number order. While this usually produces an alphabetical listing by company name, in some cases a change in a company name results in an out-of-sequence listing; thus, Continental Oil Company is found where its earlier name, Marland Oil Company, would have appeared.

did.unittitle: American Fuel Oil and Transportation Company

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included are documents from Cosden and Company (Delaware).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: See Sinclair Consolidated Oil Corporation for a market comparison between Sinclair and Cosden.

did.unittitle: Home Oil Refining Company of Texas

did.materialspec: This document is an extensive report in typescript encompassing physical, financial and production information on the company in 1936. Maps and hand-drawn diagrams are included.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included are documents from the Marland Oil Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included are documents from Cosden and Company.

did.unittitle: North Central Texas Oil Company, Incorporated

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included are documents from the Ohio Cities Gas Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included in the collection are three copies of the "First Report of Advisory committee," two of which contain large field maps.

did.unittitle: Santa Fe Oil and Refining Company

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included are documents from the Deep Rock Oil Corporation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included are documents from the Consolidated Oil Corporation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included in the collection are several glossy illustrated company magazines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included are documents by the Sinclair Crude Oil Purchasing Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents with the Texas Company logo do not refer to the original Texas Company (Texas), which was dissolved in 1927, but rather to one of the many subsidiaries of the Texas Corporation.
